title: All Types Dialog Displays Obfuscated Classes
description: When accessing the All Types dialog in JDK 1.4, it displays obfuscated classes such as 'a,' 'a1,' 'b,' 'c,' 'd,' etc.
OB: The All Types dialog in JDK 1.4 displays obfuscated classes like 'a,' 'a1,' 'b,' 'c,' 'd,' etc.
EB: Obfuscated classes such as 'a,' 'a1,' 'b,' 'c,' 'd,' etc. should be less prominent or preferably hidden in the All Types dialog.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open JDK 1.4.
2. Access the All Types dialog, e.g., through the menu or a shortcut.
3. Observe the list of classes displayed, which includes obfuscated classes like 'a,' 'a1,' 'b,' 'c,' 'd,' etc.
